entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

#CalltoAction via Black Lives Matter 5280

Join Allies to Abolitionists in holding CDPHE to account for its ongoing sweeps, demand overnight access to sanitation facilities/restrooms, and more safe outdoor spaces so that every one of our neighbors has a safe place to sleep without fear of eviction.

Black Lives Matter 5280

#CallToAction

From Allies to Abolitionists Denver is a grassroots movement demanding the abolition of systemic injustice across our city and state. Below is on...e account of such systemic injustice for which our community demands justice and accountability.
People experiencing homelessness in the city of Denver are being violently attacked and having property confiscated and damaged by your authority. There are not enough sanitation stations and portable restroom facilities for people who are experiencing homelessness in our city. During this pandemic, and the recent spike of cases, we must act now in order to save lives. These are temporary solutions that help mitigate the risk of the spread of Covid-19 and reduce the risk of death among the unhoused.
Therefore, as concerned citizens against systemic violence and criminalization of poverty, we demand that the City of Denver:
1) Immediately direct the CDPHE to terminate all evictions (sweeps) of encampments and cease enforcing the camping ban, and commit to repealing the ordinances that comprise it
2) Make existing public restroom facilities open overnight, and provide additional portable restrooms and sanitation facilities (hand washing stations) available for Denver’s unhoused people
3) Designate safe outdoor space areas for encampments for people experiencing homelessness
According to the Center for Disease control, homeless sweeps contribute to the spread of Covid-19, and prolong the need for lockdown:
https://khn.org/…/sweeps-of-homeless-camps-run-counter-to-…/
Furthermore, mental health professionals advise that sweeps of encampments exacerbate the traumas and injuries associated with those living outside:
https://denverite.com/…/denver-sweeps-of-unhoused-people-o…/
We appreciate your earnest effort and attention in this matter.
- From Allies to Abolitionists

entry.title: Disappointed in the recent decision by the Aurora City Council...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Disappointed in the recent decision by the Aurora City Council to not move forward with the Safer Aurora and Legal Defense Fund Ordinances?
Let Angela Lawson and Mike Coffman know how you feel!

Council Member Angela Lawson
720 244 6932...
alawson@auroragov.org

Mayor Mike Coffman
303 739 7015
mcoffman@auroragov.org

See MoreColorado People's Alliance

*Sigue en español*
Last night we witnessed the power and resilience of our Aurora community. We showed up for one another in support of the Safer Aurora and Leg...al Defense Fund Ordinances and listened to hours of powerful community testimony for the two policies that would have allowed our immigrant neighbors to be able to work, learn and grow in the city they call home without fear of being separated from their families.

Despite an overwhelming support, Angela Lawson and Mike Coffman chose to once again prove they are not with our immigrant community. Words mean nothing without action. Lawson and Coffman cannot continue to say they are pro-immigrant and then vote against policies that would’ve drastically improved the quality of life of our immigrant neighbors.

Despite what was said last night, immigrant justice is a Black issue. Black immigrants not only are more likely to be criminalized by the policing system, or die at the hands of law enforcement, but are also more likely to be denied bond, receive a higher bond, or be deported at a higher rate than non-Black immigrants. Because of policies like the 287(g) program, which enables local law enforcement to transfer immigrants they detain to ICE custody, the over-policing of Black people means more Black immigrants end up in ICE’s hands.

Call Angela Lawson and Mike Coffman and ask them why they failed us when most needed!

ESPAÑOL

Anoche fuimos testigos del poder y la resistencia de nuestra comunidad de Aurora. Nos presentamos el uno al otro en apoyo de las ordenanzas Un Aurora Mas Segura y el Fondo de Defensa Legal. Escuchamos horas de poderoso testimonio comunitario sobre las dos políticas que habrían permitido que nuestros vecinos inmigrantes pudieran trabajar, aprender y crecer en la ciudad que llaman hogar sin temor a ser separados de sus familias.

A pesar del apoyo abrumador, Angela Lawson y Mike Coffman decidieron demostrar una vez más que no están con nuestra comunidad de inmigrantes. Las palabras no significan nada sin acción. Lawson y Coffman no pueden seguir diciendo que son pro-inmigrantes y luego votar en contra de políticas que hubieran mejorado drásticamente la calidad de vida de nuestros vecinos inmigrantes.

A pesar de lo que se dijo anoche, la justicia de inmigrantes es un tema negro. Los inmigrantes negros no solo tienen más probabilidades de ser criminalizados por el sistema policial o de morir a manos de las fuerzas del orden público, sino que también es más probable que se les niegue la fianza, reciban una fianza más alta o sean deportados a una tasa mayor que los no negros inmigrantes. Debido a políticas como el programa 287 (g), que permite a la policía local transferir a los inmigrantes que detienen a la custodia de ICE, la vigilancia excesiva de los negros significa que más inmigrantes negros terminan en manos de ICE.

Llama a Angela Lawson y Mike Coffman y pregúntales porque nos fallaron cuando más se necesitaba

entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

CALL TO ACTION FOR COLORADO PEOPLE’S ALLIANCE!!!

WHY: Colorado People's Alliance (COPA) has been instrumental in fighting for progressive social change and racial justice locally and statewide.

WHAT: COPA’s current focus is on contacting Aurora City Council and encouraging them to support The Safer Aurora (13a) and Legal Defense Fund (13b) Ordinances. Aurora is the third largest and most diverse city in Colorado but many do not feel safe in Aurora. Black immigrants are mor...e likely to be criminalized by the policing system and are more likely to be denied bond or be deported at a higher rate than non-Black immigrants. Among other things, these ordinances would disable 287(g) contracts, which enable law enforcement to transfer immigrants they detain to ICE custody. These ordinances also offer Legal Defense Fund (13b) for those taken into custody to allow proper legal representation for those detained.

WHEN: Aurora City Council will meet to vote on these ordinances on Monday January 25 at 6:30 pm.

HOW TO HELP:
1.) Call the live public comment line at 6:00pm on Monday night and ask them to vote YES on the Safer Aurora Ordinance (13a) and Immigrant Legal Defense Fund Ordinance (13b): 855-695-3475 and press *3 for operator
To follow along with the proceedings and know exactly when the ordinances are coming up for discussion:
Join the COPA watch party - https://m.facebook.com/events/215981183457896
View the proceedings in real time - https://m.facebook.com/events/215981183457896
2.) Email or call Aurora City Council prior to Monday to express your support

entry.title: Welcome back Jeanette Vizguerra, a Mexican immigrant who has...
entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Welcome back Jeanette Vizguerra, a Mexican immigrant who has fought for labor, civil, as well as human rights for 23 years, back to Denver. Jeanette returns from Delaware after leaving the safety of sanctuary to speak at the Biden transition headquarters to fight for all 11 million undocumented immigrants in the United States.

Jeanette has fought for immigrant rights and her own deportation case for more than a decade, and she took an enormous risk to her safety and risked t...he potential separation from her children to speak out - let's show her we will fight alongside her as she and other immigrant rights advocates put pressure on the Biden administration to find a permanent path to legal status for all undocumented immigrants in the U.S.

Let's show Jeanette we know that temporary relief like DACA, TPS, and other programs for immigrant and refugee communities are not enough.

That we are furious that families have been torn apart at our borders and within our communities, incarcerated unjustly and unnecessarily during a global pandemic.

That it is unacceptable that hundreds are, like Jeanette, Ingrid Latorre, Jorge Ávila, and so many others are living in sanctuary, fighting for a way to stay with their families in the United States.

That we will not stand for a broken asylum system.

#FreeThemAll #RestoringWelcome #DontLookAway #MigrantJustice #ImmigrantJustice

entry.content:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Today, Martin Luther King Jr is revered as one of the most influential humans in history, but a poll taken in 1967 indicated that MLK Jr. was one of the most hated men in America, and 1/3 of Americans said he brought on his assassination in 1968. Leaving this type of information out of history books is very intentional. Remember him for who he truly was.

Anything else is just a lie.” Tweet is superimposed over a black and white photo of MLK raising his hand to a large crowd.
